summary: In the Q3 Fiscal Year 2024 earnings call, Apple reported a record revenue of $85.8 billion, marking a 5% increase year-over-year, with earnings per share (EPS) growing to $1.40, an 11% rise. The company achieved quarterly revenue records in over two dozen countries, indicating strong global demand. Strategic initiatives such as the rollout of Apple Intelligence were discussed, which aims to enhance app capabilities and drive engagement in the services sector. The company anticipates continued growth in services revenue, projecting double-digit growth similar to previous quarters. However, Apple acknowledged potential headwinds from foreign exchange impacts and macroeconomic conditions, which could affect future performance. Notable updates included the return to growth for iPad in Greater China and the introduction of new content for Apple TV+ and Apple Arcade. Challenges mentioned included component price inflation and the need to manage gross margins amid a fluctuating component environment.
key_highlights: Apple reported a record revenue of $85.8 billion for Q3 FY 2024, up 5% year-over-year.
Earnings per share (EPS) increased to $1.40, setting a June quarter record.
The rollout of Apple Intelligence was initiated, aimed at enhancing app capabilities.
Services revenue is expected to grow double digits, similar to previous quarters.
Challenges include foreign exchange impacts and component price inflation affecting margins.
